rename.from: how to swap face directly in video?
rename.to: how to swap face directly in video and do I need to train the model from scratch if I want to swap face from dst2src? thanks~

body:
u cant swap directly in video.
Extract frames from video.
Extract faces from frames.
Train faces.
Convert faces on frames.
Merge frames back to video.

issue.title: Extraction not working with RTX card

repository.name: DeepFaceLab
repository.description: DeepFaceLab is the leading software for creating deepfakes.

issue.body:
Extracting faces was working fine with my old 1080 but not with the 2080ti

If I run either DLIB or MT extraction it fails with this message 

"Running on GeForce RTX 2080 Ti.
You have no capable GPUs. Try to close programs which can consume VRAM, and run again."

With DLIB I get a bit more info

"Exception while initialization: Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "L:\Archives\deepfake\Peri\vengance\_internal\bin\DeepFaceLab\utils\SubprocessorBase.py", line 215, in subprocess
    fail_message = self.onClientInitialize(client_dict)
  File "L:\Archives\deepfake\Peri\vengance\_internal\bin\DeepFaceLab\mainscripts\Extractor.py", line 249, in onClientInitialize
    self.dlib = gpufmkmgr.import_dlib( self.device_idx )
  File "L:\Archives\deepfake\Peri\vengance\_internal\bin\DeepFaceLab\gpufmkmgr\gpufmkmgr.py", line 14, in import_dlib
    import dlib
ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found."


No problem training or converting, just extracting.

issue.title: Face extractor suddenly not working

repository.name: DeepFaceLab
repository.description: DeepFaceLab is the leading software for creating deepfakes.

issue.body:
I have been using this tool for weeks now with great success. Today however, I went to start a new project and when I tried to extract faces I get this:

Running extractor.

Performing 1st pass...
Running on GeForce RTX 2080 Ti #0.

 21%|################3                                                             | 1489/7096 [02:48<12:19,  7.58it/s]GeForce RTX 2080 Ti #1 doesnt response, terminating it.
 21%|################4                                                             | 1494/7096 [02:49<13:29,  6.92it/s]GeForce RTX 2080 Ti #4 doesnt response, terminating it.
 22%|#################                                                             | 1552/7096 [02:56<14:35,  6.33it/s]GeForce RTX 2080 Ti #3 doesnt response, terminating it.
 22%|#################                                                             | 1554/7096 [02:57<15:14,  6.06it/s]GeForce RTX 2080 Ti #2 doesnt response, terminating it.
 23%|##################                                                            | 1646/7096 [03:07<11:11,  8.12it/s]GeForce RTX 2080 Ti #1 doesnt response, terminating it.
 23%|##################1                                                           | 1649/7096 [03:08<10:57,  8.29it/s]GeForce RTX 2080 Ti #4 doesnt response, terminating it.
 26%|####################                                                          | 1827/7096 [03:29<13:57,  6.29it/s]

The extractor will run for a bit with varying degrees of success, but it's very slow and eventually crashes the display. Running on just one card increases the odds of success, but it's still very slow. It seems like it's asking for too much memory, but I only have a cursory knowledge of how arcane computer magic actually works, so I'm just guessing. I've read that the RTX cards are currently having TensorFlow issues, but everything has worked fine until now.

The only thing I can think of that's changed is that I moved to a new apartment. I checked all the physical connections of my computer, i.e. cards, wires, memory, etc., but everything is nicely seated. Games and movies and general computing work just fine.

Here's a pastebin of my DxDiag: https://pastebin.com/EBQnePaE

Thanks in advance for any assistance.

issue.title: [Linux] hang at doing align in Ubuntu

repository.name: DeepFaceLab
repository.description: DeepFaceLab is the leading software for creating deepfakes.

issue.body:
THIS IS NOT TECH SUPPORT FOR NEWBIE FAKERS
POST ONLY ISSUES RELATED TO BUGS OR CODE

## Expected behavior
I expected the following command to run successfully:

python3 ./main.py extract --input-dir ./workspace/data_dst --output-dir ./workspace/data_dst/align

## Actual behavior
The following command hang:

python3 ./main.py extract --input-dir ./workspace/data_dst --output-dir ./workspace/data_dst/align

The above command hang with the message below:

Running extractor.
Performing 1st pass...
Running on Tesla P100-PCIE-16GB.
Process Process-1:


## Steps to reproduce
When run the Extract command in Ubuntu system, the command hang with the following message:

Running extractor.

Performing 1st pass...
Running on Tesla P100-PCIE-16GB.
Process Process-1:

I have run the command successfully in MacOS 10.x

## Other relevant information
- python3 ./main.py extract --input-dir ./workspace/data_dst --output-dir ./workspace/data_dst/align
- Linux Ubuntu 16.04 64 bit 
- Python 3.5.2
- GPU: Tesla P100-PCIE-16GB or 1060 (neither work)

issue.title: Manual extract error

repository.name: DeepFaceLab
repository.description: DeepFaceLab is the leading software for creating deepfakes.

issue.body:
THIS IS NOT TECH SUPPORT FOR NEWBIE FAKERS
POST ONLY ISSUES RELATED TO BUGS OR CODE

## Expected behavior
*Doing manual extracts*

## Actual behavior

*Suddenly the manuel extracts stops and the software throws and error. All work on previous frames is lost.*

## Steps to reproduce

*Start manual extract, annotate a few frames and see if the software jumps out.*

Running on GeForce GTX 1080 Ti.
